intro: Adiaphila brickellioides, commonly known as the brickell's mistflower, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble clusters of tiny flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as wetlands and prairies. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are pale yellow to white. Adiaphila brickellioides is often found in swampy areas and is adapted to thrive in wet environments.
